title: Layout fixes: hero video, background text, two-card moments section, and separate gallery page

requirements.summary: Add a top-of-page hero video section above OpeningSection that renders exactly one uploaded romantic video with audio, no autoplay, and overlay text.

The hero video element does not use autoPlay and does not set muted=true by default.
The video includes visible user play controls (or an equivalent explicit play button UI) and only starts playback after a user gesture.
Only one video is rendered in the hero section even if multiple video assets exist.
Video is centered, rounded, has a soft shadow, and remains usable on mobile widths without overflow.
Overlay text ‚ÄúThis video holds a piece of my heart üíñ‚Äù is visible on top of the video.

file_operations.description: Create a new HeroVideoSection component that renders exactly one user-uploaded video from /assets (use a single explicit file reference) with controls enabled, no autoplay, not muted by default, rounded corners, soft shadow, and mobile-safe sizing; include the overlay text ‚ÄúThis video holds a piece of my heart üíñ‚Äù.
Wire HeroVideoSection into the main page render order so it appears above OpeningSection, ensuring it is the first visible hero area on the main stacked sections page.

requirements.summary: Navigate to a distinct new page/screen when either of the two cards in the moments section is clicked.

Wire the two cards to trigger navigation to the new gallery page/screen via a callback (or internal navigation helper) so the user is moved to a distinct route/view rather than expanding content in-place.

requirements.summary: Create a new gallery page/screen showing only 4‚Äì5 uploaded photos with a minimal romantic layout and soft heart animations only, with no placeholders.
acceptanceCriteria: The gallery page renders only real uploaded photo files from /assets and never renders empty slots.
The gallery page shows up to 5 photos and does not exceed 5.

requirements.summary: Enforce clean media rendering: remove placeholder generation and ensure only real uploaded media assets are shown anywhere.
acceptanceCriteria: No section renders placeholder tiles/boxes for missing photos or videos.
All media shown in the UI corresponds to real files present in /assets.

file_operations.description: Remove any remaining logic that probes for multiple possible video filenames or produces multi-tile layouts; ensure this section never renders media placeholders and does not auto-generate missing media UI.
